001
002package com.commercetools.docs.meta;
003
004import io.vrap.rmf.base.client.ApiMethod;
005
006/**
007 * <h2 id=client-tuning>Tuning the client</h2>
008 *
009 * <h3 id=blocking-execution>Blocking execution</h3>
010 *
011 * <p>In a lot of frameworks there is no support for asynchronous execution and so it is necessary to wait for the responses.
012 * The client can wait for responses with the method {@link ApiMethod#executeBlocking()}. This method enforces a timeout for
013 * resilience and throws directly {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.ApiHttpException}.</p>
014 *
015 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#executeBlocking()}
016 *
017 * <h3 id=retry-middleware>RetryMiddleware</h3>
018 *
019 * <p>The {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.http.RetryMiddleware} configures a client to handle failures like gateway timeouts
020 * and version conflicts through retrying the request.</p>
021 *
022 * <p>A best practice example to retry on gateway timeouts and similar problems</p>
023 *
024 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#retry()}
025 *
026 * <h3 id=configure-http-client>Configure the underlying http client</h3>
027 *
028 * <p>The {@link com.commercetools.api.defaultconfig.ApiRootBuilder} has create methods which allow to pass a preconfigured HTTP client.</p>
029 *
030 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#proxy()}
031 */
032public class ClientTuning {
033}
